WaiveFinesRequest.description:
The total request and all its fields are optional for backwards compatibility's sake.
If this request object is extended, it is probably best to make everything required
and remove the backwards compatibility, as the frontend will (and should) already use
this new object. See https://github.com/GEWIS/sudosos-backend/pull/344

amount.description:
The amount of fines that have to be
waived. Cannot be negative or more than the total amount of unpaid fines.

The amount of fines this user has at the current point in time,

fineWaived.description:
The amount of fines that have been waived. Should be
subtracted from the "fine" property to calculate the actual amount of fines the user has. Only
represents the current point in time, aka "now" (if any). Should be ignored if date is not now.

get.summary:
Return all users that had at most -5 euros balance both now and on the reference date.
   For all these users, also return their fine based on the reference date.

parameters.name: userTypes
parameters.description: List of all user types fines should be calculated for (MEMBER, ORGAN, VOUCHER, LOCAL_USER, LOCAL_ADMIN, INVOICE, AUTOMATIC_INVOICE).

parameters.name: referenceDates
parameters.description:
Dates to base the fines on. Every returned user has at
   least five euros debt on every reference date. The height of the fine is based on the first date in the array.

post.summary: Handout fines to all given users. Fines will be handed out "now" to prevent rewriting history.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the fine handout event which should be deleted

Performs a dry-run synchronization of users using the specified services.
